channel.title: cs.SC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: cs.SC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Factoring sparse polynomials fast
item.description: arXiv:2312.17380v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Consider a sparse polynomial in several variables given explicitly as a sum of non-zero terms with coefficients in an effective field. In this paper, we present several algorithms for factoring such polynomials and related tasks (such as gcd computation, square-free factorization, content-free factorization, and root extraction). Our methods are all based on sparse interpolation, but follow two main lines of attack: iteration on the number of variables and more direct reductions to the univariate or bivariate case. We present detailed probabilistic complexity bounds in terms of the complexity of sparse interpolation and evaluation.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Demin, Joris van der Hoeven

item.title: What Kind of Morphisms Induces Covering Maps over a Real Closed Field?
item.description: arXiv:2502.05834v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this article, we show that a flat morphism of $k$-varieties ($\mathop{\mathrm{char}} k=0$) with locally constant geometric fibers becomes finite \'etale after reduction. When $k$ is a real closed field, we prove that such a morphism induces a covering map on the rational points.
item.dc:creator: Rizeng Chen
